title: Are online courses for learning coding (python 3) worth it or should I purchase book? - Quora

response.answer_text: Honestly, there are a ton of good tutorials out there which are an awesome intro to computer science and python programming. However, some of them are free and some are not. Here are some of my recommendations. Intro to python programming by SentDex Python 3 Basics Tutorial Series - YouTubePython Programming by Jose Portilia (this is a paid course on Udemy. The great part about it is that it has short exercises after every lesson in order to enhance your understanding of the topic. However, it can only do so much to make you understand the material better. A practical application of the knowledge you have (say a game or an app) would be way better than wasting time and money on fundamentals which will get cleared anyways down the road.)Making a game using python programming (make sure you do this after you've understood the fundamentals) PyGame with Python 3 Game Development - YouTubeIntermediate level python programming Intermediate Python Programming - YouTube again by SentDex.If you hate online courses and desperately want to read a book, then you should buy the one written by the creator of python. Its price is continually fluctuating so I don't want to give any link.

Yes, It is worth it and millions of developer are learning from the video itself. personally, I love video tutorials more than a book but this is purely based on the personal choice whether you like Video tutorials or Book. Both video and book are worth it for learning any topics. If you are looking for video tutorial then check out my this answer Shankar Jha's answer to What are the best python programming online courses? If you are looking for a book then check out my this answer Shankar Jha's answer to What are the best books to begin with basics of Python?

Umm there are both free and paid courses available. But If you want to learn it in depth go for either coding ninjas course or coding blocks course. I would suggest you to go with coding ninjas.
